title: Plate, "Workers of the World Unite", 1921
markings: Marks: On underside: Vkhutemas mark (with stylized potter at wheel) stamped in orange overglaze
provenance: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection
creditline: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds
description: Circular, with shaped edge; in the center a kneeling man in Turkik costume holding a red banner inscribed, in Arabic, "Workers of the World Unite," beside him a rising sun and hammer and sickle; around the border the inscription, in Arabic, "In commemoration of the Third International Congress," intersperced with pictorial medalions showing a factory, a worker breaking chains, a woman lifting veil, a conference of men, a farmerand factory worker shaking hands

tombstone.epitaph:
Plate, "Workers of the World Unite", 1921.
1921. Porcelain, enamel, gilding. The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds. 1989-41-18.
